title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays -> Happy path
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest MLB store build
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 5 devices logged in with the same account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB app
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
4. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
5. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device
custom_expected: Then the user should see the concurrency error message on the 5th device.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify if the network disrupted then the other device should play the asset.
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest MLB store build
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 5 devices logged in with the same account
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB app 
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
4. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
5. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
6. Disconnect the WIFI in one of the devices playing asset.
custom_expected: If the user's 5th device is getting the concurrency error message when playing on 4 other devices and if one of the playing device's network is disrupted, THEN the device having the error message should be able to play the stream.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays after relaunching the App
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest MLB store build
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 5 devices logged in with the same account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB app
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
4. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
5. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
6. Exit stream on 5th device (that had seen the concurrency error).
7. Wait a little over 2 minutes. Re-launch stream on 5th device.
custom_expected: WHEN the user Re-launches stream on 5th device, then user should see the concurrency error message again.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays for the 5th and 6th device
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest MLB store build
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 6 devices logged in with the same account.
custom_steps:
1. User launches MLB app
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
4. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
5. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
6. Exit stream on 5th device (that had seen the concurrency error).
7. Activate/Launch the app in the 6th device and play the asset.
custom_expected: WHEN the user launches the stream on 6th device, then user should see the concurrency error message.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays for the 6th device
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest MLB app from store build
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 6 devices logged in with the same account
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB app
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
4. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 4 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
5. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
6. Activate/Launch the app on the 6th device and play the asset.
custom_expected: WHEN the user launches the stream on 6th device, then user should still see the concurrency error message on the 6th device.
